availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard H. Fryer (Caldwell co, ky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Regin Fryer. Married to Mildred A. Harper Fryer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in July 1855. Father of Margaret Fryer. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Employed James McChesney as a farmhand in Princeton in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 341B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 779.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 92.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 226A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546372, p. 224.
